doc.title: Li Auto Q2: Strength tested - Good company, Tough Arena
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/Bernstein/Li Auto Q2 Strength tested Good company Tough ArenaLi Auto Q2 Strength tested Good company Tough Arena_2025-08-28

passages.text: **Q2 results a miss - Good company, Tough competition.** Revenue missed due to lower volumes and slightly larger discounts, which adversely impacted operating leverage and the bottom line. Q2 25 revenue came in at RMB 30.2bn, down -4.5% yoy and +16.7% qoq,and missing Bloomberg consensus by 6%. Sales volume totaled 111.1k units, +2.3% yoy and +19.6% qoq, but ASP compressed further to RMB 260k, -6.9% yoy and -2.1% qoq,on weaker product mix (i.e. higher L6 contribution) compared to prior year, alongside intensified promotions including interest subsidies and increased sales incentives.Gross margin slid to 20.1% (vs. 19.5% in Q2 24 and 20.5% in Q1 25) as vehicle margin fell sequentially to 19.4% (vs. 18.7% in Q2 24 and 19.8% in Q1 25), primarily due to elevated promotions. Opex as % of revenue saw modest improvement to 18.3%, vs. 18.4% in Q2 24 and 19.5% in Q1 25, **reflecting effective cost control.** Nevertheless, the lower top line resulted in operating income of RMB 827 mn for the quarter, missing consensus estimates by 13%. Operating margin came in at 2.7% in Q2 25, vs. 1.5% in Q2 2024 and 1.0% in Q1 25.Diluted EPS reached RMB 1.03, lower vs. consensus at RMB 1.62.

**Grim Q3 outlook - Core EREV portfolio challenged.** Q3 revenue is guided to RMB 24.8-26.2bn (down 42.1% to 38.8% yoy), sales volume of 90-95k units (down 41.1% to 37.8% yoy), and gross margin at c.19%. This implies monthly deliveries of 30-32k units for August and September—broadly flat versus July's 31k but c.20% below Q2 25 levels.Given that Management expects i8 deliveries to reach 8-10k units by end-September, this implies the L-series monthly runrate is forecast at c.26k units for August and September,down c.15% from July and c.30% from Q2 25, highlighting intensifying competition in the high-end PHEV SUV segment. **We recently downgraded Li Auto to Market-Perform amid concerns over rising EREV competition and a challenging BEV transition. The weak Q3 guidance reinforces these concerns.** (For more: Li Auto: Bumpier road ahead -Downgrade to Market-Perform)
**Investment Implications**

We rate **Li Auto Market-Perform and lowered price targets for LI.U.S to US$25.00** (old:US$26.00) and for 2015.HK to HK$98.00 (old: HK$102.00). We value Li Auto on blended 1-yr forward 0.5x EV/sales and 15x P/E (unchanged).

Despite a more challenging Q3, management is constructive on Q4 and beyond, expecting growth driven by VLA- enhanced ADAS, new product strategy, and distribution channel reform. Management expects monthly deliveries can resume to 50k month run- rate in Q4, though Q4 gross margin could see downward pressure from more promotions and i6, depending on pricing.

VLA- enhanced ADAS solutions as a key differentiator: The company aims to enhance its product competitiveness and strengthen its market positioning through sharpened ADAS technology. The recently launched preview version on i8 already provides VLA Driving, VLA Parking and VLA summon functions. A complete version will be rolled out with the OTA upgrades for all AD Max users in September, introducing VLA Command, which will deliver a more intelligent and convenient user experience. Another major upgrade is scheduled for November, which will bring additional user value creation. VLA incorporates generative AI capabilities, making it more advanced compared to traditional end- to- end approaches. It requires stronger computational power and larger models, particularly at the edge. With continued improvements in model training and computing resources, VLA autonomous driving development is expected to accelerate significantly, with the company targeting L4 autonomy by 2027.

i6 launch and accelerated product cycles: Management shared that i6 is well on track to debut and begin deliveries by the end of September, which will reinvigorate the product cycle and set the stage for growth acceleration in Q4 25 and 2026. Beyond i6, Li Auto plans to streamline its model variants and accelerate its product cycle, aiming for major upgrades every two years- reduced from the previous four years and significantly shorter than the eight- year cycle typical of traditional European OEMs.

Revamped distribution system: Li Auto recently restructured its sales network with optimized store locations and overhauled sales system. The streamlined structure empowers a more locally tailored sales policies. The company also shifts to proactive go- to- market strategy, with a revamped training and incentive system to strengthen the sales team capabilities.

Overseas: In 2025, the company began its overseas expansion by establishing R&D centers in Germany and the US, and setting up sales, after- sales, and IT systems abroad. The market focus targets the Middle East, Central Asia, and Europe. Products under development for 2026 will proactively consider overseas laws and regulations.

We appreciate the company's accelerated progress in ADAS development, which demonstrates Li Auto's technological leadership and should help strengthen the company's premium brand image. However, near- term monetization opportunities may be limited. While Li Auto has strong product capabilities, its brand reach remains relatively weaker compared to competitors like Tesla and Xiaomi, and its i6 launch may be challenged. Faster product iteration cycles can help maintain market relevance amid intense competition, though this may put pressure on gross margins.

Following peers such as NIO and XPeng, which have been developing their own ADAS chips, Li Auto has also provided an update on its progress. Li Auto announced it taped out its ADAS chip in early 2025 and is now conducting in- vehicle testing, with launch planned for next year's flagship model. Development began three years ago, with management noting rapid progress relative to peers.

The chip reportedly delivers 2x processing power for Large Language Models and 3x for Vision- Based Models compared to the strongest market alternatives. Its data- driven architecture is designed for large neural networks. Software and hardware we've developed simultaneously to maximize integration and AI performance. The company reports that the chip's computational power effectively enhances ADAS capabilities. Management is confident the chip will become a key competitive advantage.

We maintain a neutral stance on OEMs developing their own ADAS chips. While OEMs often cite cost savings, software- hardware optimization, and supply chain independence as key benefits, the effort requires substantial investment and significant scale to be economically viable.

We updated our financial projections for Li Auto following review of Q2 25 results. We now forecast Li Auto to deliver sales volume of \(449k / 594k\) units in 2025/2026. We tweak down our gross margin forecasts to \(19.4\% /18.9\%\) for 2025/2026 and EPS (basic) to arrive at RMB 2.08/RMB 4.67 per share for 2025/2026. For 2025, the downward revision of earnings estimates is primarily driven by lower sales volume based on the guidance from management and recent sales momentum, as well as a weaker profitability in light of its product cycle. Exhibit 12 shows a summary of our estimate changes for Li Auto. We rate Li Auto Outperform and PT US \(25.00\) (Old: US \(26.00\)). We value Li Auto on a blended 1- yr forward 0.5x EV/sales and 15x P/E.

EXHIBIT 10: Li Auto saw its overall EV market share decline from peak of 5.7% in July 2024 to 3.2% in June and July 2025, and we do not expect a meaningful reversal in the near-term; June and July 2025 also saw - 25% and - 39% yoy decline in retail sales volume, respectively

On April 1, 2024, Société Générale (SG) and AllianceBernstein, LP. (AB) completed a transaction that created a new joint venture in which their respective cash equities and research businesses operate in a new business combination. Although their respective ownership percentages in the joint venture differ between North America and the rest of the world, the creation, production and publication of research is handled collaboratively on a global basis across the two research brands, "Bernstein" and "Autonomous". Unless specifically noted otherwise, for purposes of these disclosures, references to Bernstein's "affiliates" relate to both SG and AB and their respective affiliates.
We value Li Auto primarily using forward EV/sales and P/E multiples.
We value Li Auto on blended 1- yr forward 0.5x EV/sales and 15x P/E, and arrive at price targets for LIUS at US \(25.00 and for 2015. HK at HK\) 98.00.

The main upside risks related to better than expected sales performance of the recently launched i8 and upcoming i6 models, and faster than expected progress on international expansion. We see downside risks around Li Auto relate to sales of current and future vehicles, particularly the upcoming launch of i6 scheduled for September, product quality and potential recalls, and future product and technology development.

The Bernstein brand rates stocks based on forecasts of relative performance for the next 12 months versus the S&P 500 for stocks listed on the U.S. and Canadian exchanges, versus the Bloomberg Europe Developed Markets Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (EDM) for stocks listed on the European exchanges and emerging markets exchanges outside of the Asia Pacific region, versus the Bloomberg Japan Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index USD (JP) for stocks listed on the Japanese exchanges, and versus the Bloomberg Asia ex- Japan Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (ASIAX) for stocks listed on the Asian (ex- Japan) exchanges - unless otherwise specified.
The Bernstein brand has three categories of ratings:

- Outperform: Stock will outpace the market index by more than 15 pp- Market-Perform: Stock will perform in line with the market index to within +/-15 pp- Underperform: Stock will trail the performance of the market index by more than 15 pp

Coverage Suspended: Coverage of a company under the Bernstein research brand has been suspended. Ratings and price targets are suspended temporarily, are no longer current, and should therefore not be relied upon.

Not Rated: A rating assigned when the stock cannot be accurately valued, or the performance of the company accurately predicted, at the present time. The covering analyst may continue to publish research reports on the company to update investors on events and developments.
Not Covered (NC) denotes companies that are not under coverage.

The Autonomous brand rates stocks as indicated below. As our benchmarks we use the Bloomberg Europe 500 Banks And Financial Services Index (BEBANKS) and Bloomberg Europe Dev Mkt Financials Large and Mid Cap Price Ret Index EUR (EDMFI)index for developed European banks and Payments, the Bloomberg Europe 500 Insurance Index (BEINSUR) for European insurers, the S&P 500 and S&P Financials for US banks and Payments coverage, S5LIFE for US Insurance, the S&P Insurance Select Industry (SPSIINS) for US Non-Life Insurers coverage, and the Bloomberg Emerging Markets Financials Large, Mid and Small Cap Price Return Index (EMLSF) for emerging market banks and insurers and Payments. Ratings are stated relative to the sector (not the market).
The Autonomous brand has three categories of ratings:
·Outperform (OP): Stock will outpace the relevant index by more than 10 pp
·Neutral (N): Stock will perform in line with the market index to within +/-10 pp
·Underperform (UP): Stock will trail the performance of the relevant index by more than 10 pp

Coverage Suspended: Coverage of a company under the Bernstein research brand has been suspended. Ratings and price targets are suspended temporarily, are no longer current, and should therefore not be relied upon.

Not Rated: A rating assigned when the stock cannot be accurately valued, or the performance of the company accurately predicted, at the present time. The covering analyst may continue to publish research reports on the company to update investors on events and developments.
Those denoted as 'Feature' (e.g., Feature Outperform FOP, Feature Under Outperform FUP) are our core ideas. Not Covered (NC)denotes companies that are not under coverage.
For both brands, recommendations are based on a 12-month time horizon.
